articles.author: Erin Cunningham, Kareem Fahim, Mustafa Salim
articles.title: Body of commander slain by U.S. strike arrives in Iran to crowds of mourners
articles.description: The body of Maj. Gen. Qasem Soleimani was flown to the Iranian city of Ahvaz following a funeral procession in Iraq.
articles.content:
Soleimanis body was flown to Ahvaz, in southwest Iran, in a flag-draped coffin following a funeral procession in Baghdad and the two Iraqi shrine cities of Karbala and Najaf.
In footage broadcast on Iranian state television, black-clad mourners filled Ahvazs… [+6183 chars]

articles.author: Associated Press
articles.title: Car plows into German tourists in northern Italy, 6 dead
articles.description: Italian fire officials say a car has plowed into a group of young German tourists in northern Italy
articles.content:
The Luttach volunteer fire service said in a Facebook post that the six dead were killed at the scene. The injured were taken to several nearby hospitals.
Sky TG24 quoted Italian carabinieri as saying the driver was believed to be from the area and had a hig… [+157 chars]

articles.title: Car plows into crowd of young Germans gathering near bus at night in northern Italy, 6 dead

articles.author: Associated Press
articles.title: Hong Kong protesters march through border town
articles.description: Hong Kong protesters are marching through a border town to oppose traders from mainland China
articles.content:
Some black-clad protesters held up signs that read SARS, in apparent reference to a mysterious infectious disease that may have been brought to Hong Kong from the central Chinese city of Wuhan, where at least 44 people have been infected.
The outbreak has re… [+477 chars]

articles.author: Max Bearak
articles.title: Al-Shabab attacks joint U.S.-Kenyan base, but assault repulsed with four militants killed
articles.description: The attack comes almost a year after the bloody storming of a luxury hotel in Nairobi.
articles.content: U.S. military personnel train Kenyan soldiers at a base attached to the airstrip, known as Camp Simba, and the U.S. military uses the airstrip for aerial missions against al-Shabab in Somalia. Capt. Marcie Mascaro, a spokeswoman for U.S. Africa Command, ackno… [+3002 chars]

articles.author: Samy Magdy | AP
articles.title: Death toll from airstrike in Libya's Tripoli climbs to 30
articles.description: Libyan health officials say the death toll from an airstrike that slammed into a military academy in Libya's capital has climbed to at least 30 people, most of them students
articles.content:
The airstrike took place late Saturday in the capitals Hadaba area, just south of the city center where fighting has been raging for months.
The ambulance service in Tripoli said the airstrike also wounded at least 33 others. It posted images of dead bodies … [+1178 chars]

articles.author: Abdi Guled and Tom Odula | AP
articles.title: Al-Shabab claims attack on base serving US, Kenyan troops
articles.description: The al-Shabab extremist group says it has attacked a military base used by U.S. and Kenyan troops in coastal Kenya
articles.content: The U.S. Africa Command confirms the attack on Camp Simba in Lamu county. An internal Kenyan police report seen by The Associated Press says two fixed-wing aircraft, one U.S. and one Kenyan, were destroyed along with two U.S. helicopters and multiple U.S. veh… [+1993 chars]

articles.author: Darko Bandic | AP
articles.title: EU chair Croatia votes in tight presidential runoff
articles.description: Voters in Croatia are casting ballots to elect a new president between the fiercely opposed conservative incumbent and her leftist challenger in what is expected to be a very tight and unpredictable race
articles.content:
Sundays runoff presidential vote is expected to be a very tight and unpredictable race.
Its being held because none of the candidates won more than half of the votes in the first round on Dec. 22. Current President Kolinda Grabar Kitarovic is running for a s… [+2183 chars]
